action.name: acFindWindow

parameters.parameter: The class name of the window to be located
The title of the window to be located

action.name: acRegistryCreateKey

The path of the key to be created (\ must be escaped as \\)

action.description: Creates a new key at the specified path.
action.snippet: acRegistryCreateKey(2, "Software\\MyApp") --Creates a new key under HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE named MyApp

action.name: acRegistryDeleteKey

parameters.parameter: The root registry key: 1 = HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT 2 = HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE 3 = HKEY_CURRENT_USER 4 = HKEY_USERS
The path of the key to be deleted (\ must be escaped as \\)

action.description: Delete the key at the specified path. Will not delete if subkeys exist; subkeys must be deleted first.

action.name: acRegistryDeleteValue

parameters.parameter: The root registry key: 1 = HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT 2 = HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE 3 = HKEY_CURRENT_USER 4 = HKEY_USERS
The path to the key where the value to be deleted exists (\ must be escaped as \\)
The name of the value to be deleted

action.description: Delete the value at the specified path/name.

action.name: acRegistryGetNumber

parameters.parameter: The root registry key: 1 = HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT 2 = HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE 3 = HKEY_CURRENT_USER 4 = HKEY_USERS
The path to the key where the value to be retrieved exists (\ must be escaped as \\)
The name of the value to be retrieved
The default value to be returned if not found

action.return: Value or default if not found
action.description: Gets the value at the specified key/path/name.
action.snippet: acRegistryGetNumber(2,"Software\\MyApp","Setting1",0) --Gets the Setting1 value in the MyApp key under HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE, or returns 0 if it doesn't exist

action.name: acRegistryGetString

parameters.parameter: The root registry key: 1 = HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT 2 = HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE 3 = HKEY_CURRENT_USER 4 = HKEY_USERS
The path to the key where the value to be retrieved exists (\ must be escaped as \\).
The name of the value to be retrieved
The default value to be returned if not found

action.return: Value or default if not found
action.description: Gets the value at the specified key/path/name. Keys of the type REG_EXPAND_SZ will have their environment variables expanded as available.
action.snippet: acRegistryGetString(2,"Software\\MyApp","Setting2","Not Found") --Gets the Setting2 value in the MyApp key under HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE, or returns "Not Found" if it doesn't exist

action.name: acRegistrySetNumber

parameters.parameter: The root registry key: 1 = HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT 2 = HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE 3 = HKEY_CURRENT_USER 4 = HKEY_USERS
The path to the key where the value is to be stored (\ must be escaped as \\)

action.description: Sets the value at the specified key/path/name.
action.snippet: acRegistrySetNumber(2,"Software\\MyApp","Setting1",4) --Sets the Setting1 value to 4 in the MyApp key under HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE

action.name: acRegistrySetString

parameters.parameter: The root registry key: 1 = HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT 2 = HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE 3 = HKEY_CURRENT_USER 4 = HKEY_USERS
The path to the key where the value is to be stored (\ must be escaped as \\)
The name of the value to be stored

The key type to be stored as: 1 = REG_SZ (default) 2 = REG_EXPAND_SZ

action.name: acConsumePhysicalInput

parameters.parameter: Whether to consume all physical input, 0 = False, 1 = True

action.description: Tells S+ to consume ALL physical input (mouse and keyboard). This may be useful if you're about to call a mouse or keyboard action where you don't want any physical input to interfere with the action. But make sure you call again, passing 0, to enable input or your computer may become unusable!
action.snippet: acConsumePhysicalInput(1) --sample instructs S+ to consume ALL input (make sure to call acConsumePhysicalInput(0) within the SAME Lua script or your computer may become unusable!).
